definition: to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
to split/to crack/to break open/to rend

sentences.english: To do this they had no need to break with Bolshevism.
sentences.chinese: 爲了這樣做他們無須和布爾什維克主義決裂。

sentences.english: So what was the headline on an Associated Press analysis of that breakdown in negotiations?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，美聯社對談判決裂新聞分析的標題是什麼？

sentences.english: She tried to dissociate herself from her past.
sentences.chinese: 她努力使自己與自己的過去決裂。

sentences.english: As you grow wiser, you should break with your old ideas.
sentences.chinese: 你變得更聰明些了，就應該與舊思想決裂。

sentences.english: He has already broken with that gang.
sentences.chinese: 他已經和那個幫派組織決裂了。

sentences.english: When faced with a delayed answer, do you break with God?
sentences.chinese: 當面對延遲的應許時，你就與神決裂了嗎？

sentences.english: At the period of "Wusi" , the intellect of China broke firmly with traditional culture.
sentences.chinese: “五四”時期，中國知識分子毅然與傳統文化決裂。

sentences.english: China’s policy on Libya is clearly a break from the principle of keeping-low-profile.
sentences.chinese: 中國的利比亞政策是與韜光養晦原則的決裂。

sentences.english: For this he decided to break with his feudalistic family .
sentences.chinese: 爲此他決定和他的封建主義家庭決裂。

sentences.english: Had the coach and his boss had a bust up?
sentences.chinese: 到底穆帥和他的老闆有沒有決裂？

sentences.english: Finally, law enforcement must crack down on collusion.
sentences.chinese: 最後，執法者必須與勾結串通決裂。

sentences.english: Our feelings after all the rain and wind, couldn't help eventually break down.
sentences.chinese: 我們的情感畢竟禁不住那風吹雨打，終極決裂。

sentences.english: His life could not be further removed from the unusual family in which he grew up.
sentences.chinese: 他的生活卻與成長期所在異常的家庭徹底決裂了。

sentences.english: This manifests the solemn and stirring character of raptural situation in the revolutionary literature.
sentences.chinese: 這顯示出革命文學“決裂”場景的悲壯性。

sentences.english: Xu Wenqiang and Ding showdown break.
sentences.chinese: 許文強與丁力攤牌決裂。

sentences.english: The room soon filled with the water spurting from the broken pipe.
sentences.chinese: 決裂的水管中的水很快就濺得房間裏隨處都是。

definition: lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
to fall short of/to have a deficit/deficit/deficiency
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
